sources.title: Behind That Curtain (1929) DVD MKV
sources.description: DVD remux of the 1929 Fox film "Behind That Curtain," the earliest surviving film to feature the character Charlie Chan. IMDb TMDB Wikipedia Behind That Curtain is a 1929 American Pre-Code mystery film directed by Irving Cummings and starring Warner Baxter, Lois Moran and Gilbert Emery. It was the first Charlie Chan film to be made at Fox Studios. It was based on the 1928 novel of the same name. Charlie Chan, who is played by the Chinese American E. L. Park, gets one mention early in the film, then makes a few momentary appearances after 75 minutes. Park, in fact, was the first Chinese American to play Charlie Chan on-screen. Producer William Fox chose this film to open the palatial Fox Theatre in San Francisco on June 28, 1929. It was a sound film.

sources.description:
It's Friday @PizzaFLIX 
Stars: Warner Baxter, Lois Moran, Gilbert Emery, Boris Karloff
Writer: Earl Derr Biggers (based on a novel by)
Director: Irving Cummings
üçïNEW STUNNING HD PRESENTATIONüçï
Step back into the golden age of Pre-Code Hollywood with the first sound film to feature legendary detective Charlie Chan‚Äîthough blink and you might miss him! This rare gem from Fox Movietone blends romantic mystery, exotic locales, and shadowy intrigue. 

Fresh off his Oscar win for IN OLD ARIZONA, Warner Baxter stars as a tormented adventurer ensnared in a dangerous web of passion and betrayal alongside the luminous Lois Moran and the enigmatic Gilbert Emery.

Adapted from the novel by Earl Derr Biggers, creator of the iconic Charlie Chan series, and directed by Irving Cummings, this early talkie weaves suspense and melodrama in a way only Pre-Code cinema could deliver. Keep your eyes peeled for a brief but eerie appearance by a young Boris Karloff, slipping through the shadows long before his monster-making fame.

Are you a PizzaFLIX Fanatic? Join our exclusive Fan Club for dedicated Classic movie lovers: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCE34fwgW7kWr7tc7YiOWtRw/join

Perfect for fans of classic mysteries, Pre-Code drama, and vintage Hollywood stars, this PizzaFLIX presentation is a must-watch for lovers of rare cinematic history. Don‚Äôt forget to like, comment, and subscribe for more hidden treasures from the dawn of sound!

metadata.Plot: Sir George hires Hillary Gatt to find out more about Eric who wants to marry Lois. Gatt is murdered and the couple, married, run off to India. Old friend John Beetham sympathizes with the bride who sees that her hubby is a liar and drunk. John and Lois fly to San Francisco. Eric shows up and tries to kill John, but Scotland Yard and Lt. Charlie Chan intervene.
metadata.Writer: Earl Derr Biggers, George Middleton, Clarke Silvernail
metadata.Actors: Warner Baxter, Lois Moran, Gilbert Emery
